name:
Château Angelus
Le Carillon d’Angélus Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2016
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Château Angelus'], ['Grapes', '100% Merlot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Libournais', 'Saint-Émilion', 'Saint-Émilion Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Émilion'], ['Alcohol content', '14%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', "Château Angélus has a second wine named Le Carillon d’Angélus. It was first made in 1987 and accounts for 20 to 30% of the estate’s total production, depending on the year. It is blended from varying proportions of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon that are partly picked on unclassified plots with clayey limestone and clayey sandy limestone soils. The vines are cared for in exactly the same way as those used to make the main wine. The same attention is paid to detail and selection during the harvest and winemaking as for the main wine. It is also aged in barrels, but not for so long and only half the wood is new in order to suit the wine's specific requirements. Le Carillon d’Angélus therefore has its own identity and style. It is made to be kept for the mid-term and displays enjoyable fruit aromas of plum and sour cherry and has velvet-smooth tannins."]]

name:

about_wine: [['Winery', "Cos d'Estournel"], ['Grapes', '100% Cabernet Sauvignon'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Saint-Estèphe'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Estèphe'], ['Alcohol content', '14%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites, egg allergens, milk allergens'], ['Bottle closure', 'Cork'], ['Wine description', 'The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.']]

name:

about_wine: [['Winery', "Cos d'Estournel"], ['Grapes', '100% Cabernet Sauvignon'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Saint-Estèphe'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Estèphe'], ['Alcohol content', '13%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.']]

about_wine: [['Winery', "Cos d'Estournel"], ['Grapes', '65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Saint-Estèphe'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Estèphe'], ['Alcohol content', '14%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Bottle closure', 'Cork'], ['Wine description', 'The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.']]

name:
Cos d'Estournel
Pagodes de Cos 2010
about_wine: [['Winery', "Cos d'Estournel"], ['Grapes', '62% Cabernet Sauvignon, 38% Merlot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Saint-Estèphe'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Estèphe'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'The joy and spontaneity of moments shared with loved ones. An impromptu lunch with friends is the perfect occasion to open a bottle of Pagodes de Cos. It is reminiscent of the simple pleasures of life, like homemade blackcurrant syrup, a bowl of just-picked red cherries or a freshly opened jar of citrus jam. Pagodes de Cos is at once indulgent, comforting and vivacious, like a carefree conversation with family or friends in a familiar place.']]

name:
Cos d'Estournel
Cos d'Estournel 1990
about_wine: [['Winery', "Cos d'Estournel"], ['Grapes', 'Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Petit Verdot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Saint-Estèphe'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Estèphe'], ['Alcohol content', '13%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.']]

name:
Cos d'Estournel
Cos d'Estournel 2016
about_wine: [['Winery', "Cos d'Estournel"], ['Grapes', '100% Merlot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Saint-Estèphe'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Estèphe'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.']]

name:
Cos d'Estournel
Cos d'Estournel 2020
about_wine: [['Winery', "Cos d'Estournel"], ['Grapes', 'Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Petit Verdot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Saint-Estèphe'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Estèphe'], ['Alcohol content', '13%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites, egg allergens, milk allergens'], ['Bottle closure', 'Cork'], ['Wine description', 'The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.']]

name:
Château Angelus
Le Carillon d’Angélus Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2012
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Château Angelus'], ['Grapes', 'Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Libournais', 'Saint-Émilion', 'Saint-Émilion Grand Cru'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Émilion'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', "Château Angélus has a second wine named Le Carillon d’Angélus. It was first made in 1987 and accounts for 20 to 30% of the estate’s total production, depending on the year. It is blended from varying proportions of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon that are partly picked on unclassified plots with clayey limestone and clayey sandy limestone soils. The vines are cared for in exactly the same way as those used to make the main wine. The same attention is paid to detail and selection during the harvest and winemaking as for the main wine. It is also aged in barrels, but not for so long and only half the wood is new in order to suit the wine's specific requirements. Le Carillon d’Angélus therefore has its own identity and style. It is made to be kept for the mid-term and displays enjoyable fruit aromas of plum and sour cherry and has velvet-smooth tannins."]]

Pomerol 2018
about_wine: [['Winery', 'Château La Fleur-Pétrus'], ['Grapes', '100% Merlot'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Libournais', 'Pomerol'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Pomerol'], ['Alcohol content', '13.5%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Bottle closure', 'Cork'], ['Wine description', 'On the nose a tight core of black fruits, blackcurrants and dark cherries. Beautifully textured on the palate, sweet and quite fleshy, supple and flattering. Lots of ripe tannins but they are very well hidden by this layer of fruit, with a lovely sense of grip coming in. Great acidity at the core. Wonderful structure and balance here, and an elegant substance to the finish.']]

name:
Cos d'Estournel
Cos d'Estournel 2008
about_wine: [['Winery', "Cos d'Estournel"], ['Grapes', '85% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Merlot, 2% Cabernet Franc'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Saint-Estèphe'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Estèphe'], ['Alcohol content', '14%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites'], ['Wine description', 'The call of faraway lands. As mysterious and intriguing as a lone adventurer returning from a solitary sail, Cos d’Estournel is slow to reveal itself. Little by little, it evokes stories of distant places, market stalls brimming with unfamiliar fruits, spices and wares, village festivities warmed by the joy of revelers and the setting sun, and sumptuous visions of ladies and their voluptuous curves. A myriad of scents, colors and tastes appeals to the senses. The Grand Vin of Cos d’Estournel is both demure and deliberately sensuous, a fascinating and elegant nectar.']]

name:

Pagodes de Cos 2020
about_wine: [['Winery', "Cos d'Estournel"], ['Grapes', 'Merlot, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc'], ['France', 'Bordeaux', 'Médoc', 'Saint-Estèphe'], ['Wine style', 'Bordeaux Saint-Estèphe'], ['Alcohol content', '13.3%'], ['Allergens', 'Contains sulfites, egg allergens, milk allergens'], ['Wine description', 'The joy and spontaneity of moments shared with loved ones. ", '', 'Read our reviews, flavor profiles and wine pairing recommendations, or get your hands on this wine today at Vivino US.']]

The result is of great elegance and breed. The tannins are refined and the silk and velvet of the body are a perfect match. ', '', "Boasting notes of red fruit, as well as oaky and earthy flavors such as chocolate, leather and mushroom, the profile of Château de Chamirey Mercurey 1er Cru 'Clos du Roi' pairs extremely well with beef, veal, game and poultry. A medium body, bordering on full, with juicy fine tannins that give the wine a classical structure. Red and black berry fruits, pepper, licorice and a little tobacco are all evident on the palate. A very long and mouth watering finish. Drinks particularly well now, but will benefit from a few more years in the bottle.']]
